context: The Estonian word 'hulgur' means a vagrant or tramp - someone who wanders without a permanent home. It's often used in compound words to describe someone living outdoors (ilma|hulgus = outdoor vagrant, metsa|hulgus = forest vagrant) and can carry negative connotations when used as an insult.
